The building contains a 1,500-seat theater, two 800-seat spherical frame and multi-form medium-sized theater, the largest feature is that the three theaters can operate independently. If you need a large performance, you can also combine two of the theaters into a "super-large theater" that can accommodate 2550 seats, 65 meters long and 18 meters wide. Part 2

It is the fundamental Taoist field of Linji Zongmiaoxin Temple in Taiwan. The architectural form of Daxiong Pavilion takes the imitation Song-style Buddhist Temple pattern of Japan Jialan. The roof has a positive ridge. The four ridges and four ridges of the rest of the mountain, the temple tube tiles are engraved with the word "town". Li Ganlang said that the largest Japanese-era wooden structure in Taiwan was originally located in the West Benyuan Temple in Wanhua District, but after it was burned by the unknown fire, Linji Huguo Temple later lived up to become the largest building. The temple is dedicated to the three worshippers of Sakya (Sakya Buddha, Wenshu Bodhisattva, Puxian Bodhisattva) part 3

address: No.98 Yanping South Road, Taipei, Taiwan
review: Zhongshan Hall is located on Yanping South Road, Zhongzheng District, Taipei City, Taiwan. It was the first exhibition building in Taiwan. It was completed on November 26, 1936, during the Japanese rule of Taiwan, and was called Taipei Hall. It was a work of well-known Japanese architects. In 1931, the Governor's Office decided to build Taipei Hall (that is, Zhongshan Hall) in the square in front of the Prefectural Bureau of the Ministry of Justice, in honor of the accession of the Emperor Showa. In addition to some of the buildings of the Zhengfu Si'anmen and Qin Chahangtai moved to Yuanshan Zoo (now Taipei City Children's Yule Center yesterday) and the Taipei Botanical Garden, the remaining nearby houses (including Taiwan's Anmen of the Governor) were demolished in August 1932. Construction began in Taipei Hall in December. Completed in December 1936, the construction period was four years. The building was designed by the then Governor's House Camp-Courtwell bracelet.

address: 207, Taiwan, New Taipei City, Wanli District, 港東路167-1號
review: The Queen's Head is a business card for Taiwan tourism. The scorpion is the most representative terrain of the wild willow, especially the noble form of the Queen's head, which has become a symbol of the Wild Willow Geopark. The neck is long, the face is beautiful, and the appearance is like the noble Queen.

address: No. 202, Section 2, Zhishan Road, Taipei
review: The first time I visited the Coral Museum, I used to go to the Ocean Park to see it. I didn’t expect there to be a more professional museum. The venue is not big but the exhibits are quite good. Many rare corals have it. The shape is very good.

address: Zhongli District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan
review: Coming abroad, it's hard to find a Thai restaurant to eat easily. At Taoyuan, Zhongli District We would like to recommend a Thai restaurant here. The taste is very spicy, very good 9/10 It's authentic Thai taste.

address: Above Dongdong Bay, Binhai Highway, Ruifang District, New Taipei City
review: I passed the thirteenth floor when I came to the northeast corner to play before, and I thought it was like ..... But this time, after seeing the light news, I quickly arranged a holiday to go to the pilgrimage. It’s really beautiful after lighting on the spot. We are watching the lights at the observation deck of the Shuiyudong parking lot, but this location does not seem to be the best photography point. When we left, we saw a group of photographers and then took pictures on the side of the road in the direction of the Shenzhen-Australia Fishing Port. Friends who want to take pictures can pay attention to it. I have come here before. The parking lot is so big, but it is empty, and there are a few cars parked in scattered. This time I found that there are more tourists. It turned out to be a little light activity recently. I was really surprised. I could have such a special way of showing, but I was too rushed to leave that day. I didn't see the light ... but I really think it is beautiful. Looking at it, it seems to walk into another world. I have the opportunity to witness the 13-story ruins that have been lit up!

subTitleName: 金車噶瑪蘭威士忌 酒廠
address: No. 326, Section 2, Yuanshan Road, Yuanshan Township, Yilan County
review: Free tour of the whisky distillery, the hinterland is vast. Previously, 10ml whisky for one person was provided for free, but now it costs an additional 100 yuan, but it can be discounted for wine consumption. The factory has a knowledge of whisky introduction, as well as whisky brewing equipment for visiting, and the overall environment is clean and bright. If you like wine, this is a good place to visit.

address: No.2, Aly. 14, Ln. 230 Sec. 3, Tingzhou Rd., Taipei, Zhongzheng District, Taipei 100 Taiwan
review: Treasure Rock International Art Village - Its historical axis, in addition to the Treasure Rock Temple, which contains the city's monuments, is more generally referred to the historical settlement that extends from this temple, which was mainly formed by illegal buildings built in the 60s and 70s. These buildings are built by mountains and rivers, scattered and complex, showing the special settlement of Taiwan.

address: No. 9, Lane 45, Minsheng W Rd, Zhongshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 104
review: Students' children prepare for the exam next week, and accompany them to Taipei Wenchang Palace today to visit, praying for the blessing of Emperor Wenchang, the exam is successful, and admiring the beautifully decorated temple buildings.

address: 北投區泉源路200號
review: A more famous landscape area in the local area, you can check in and see, not bad.

address: Wujie No. 81, Section 3, Wujie Road
review: Although it is just a small building, it is far from a museum. It is full of surprises. Art frames and body paintings. Friends who like to take beautiful photos or make strange things can show their skills. The guides are kind and DIY. Good interaction. The only small "frame museum" in Asia. It is a good attraction for the family to travel with laughter ～

address: No. 369, Section 7, Zhongxiao East Road, Nangang District, Taipei City
review: Shaowu Bookstore TSUTAYA BOOKSTORE. The largest and most beautiful bookstore in Taiwan, covering an area of 500 pings, with the theme of BOOK&CAFE living proposal, the space planning design is not only wider and more comfortable, but also more beautiful and more yuan! In addition to combining the WIRED CHAYA tea house and wind catering brands of CAF COMANY in Japan, more Taiwan local brands Louisa Coffee Luisa coffee, and Taiwan herbal tea brand Xiaocao to create a new store-based bookstore. In addition, the Nangang store not only provides more seats, so that the reading time is more comfortable, but also designs to create a variety of surprise reading space, its comfort and comfort level is simply a bunch of unlimited time, no service fee, WIFI, socket coffee shop, What's better is that it also lets you read for free and see fullness and no low consumption! ! !

address: Zhongpo South Road, Nangang District, Taipei City, Taiwan 115
review: Very suitable for walking park, there is a basketball court and swimming pool on the other side, and the other side is like a forest.

address: Songshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 105
review: Baoqing Park is not very big, but it is located in the downtown area, and there are still a lot of people in the park. The park is very beautiful and lush with birds and flowers. Like many parks in Taiwan, there are also many fitness facilities in the park.

address: Da’an District, Taipei City, 106
review: Wenzhou Street, which has been visiting since the evening, is still very interesting. The houses are not very new. There are floor shops along the street on both sides, various restaurants, individual shops, and bars. A street with a taste.

address: Taipei City, Taiwan
review: It is also the film and television dramas, so it has become a holy place for people to check in now. Huayin Street actually feels more distinctive. I like to walk around here and experience the life of local residents.

address: Cianshueiwan St., Sanjhih Dist, New Taipei 252, Taiwan
review: The English name of Repulse Bay is said to have originated from a Royal British warship that used to be stationed in the bay to prevent pirates, meaning "repel". Repulse Bay has been famous for a long time. The venue for the two high-handed fighting methods in the classic work of famous novelist Zhang Ailing in modern times, "Love in the City", is the Repulse Bay Hotel.

address: Wenshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 116
review: The elm trail is a pedestrian trail on the top of the catkong mountain, and you can see signs near the cable car station. The trail is well repaired, flat, easy to walk, and the slope is not big. There are several specialty restaurants near the entrance on both sides of the trail, and the small rural-style house is very nice. The scenery on both sides of the trail is good, and there are large tea gardens. The air on the top of the mountain is also good.

address: Taipei City, Taiwan
review: Xikou Wharf - Songshan area was in Qianlong years, the ancient name of "Xikou". Located at the water gate of Songhe Street, Xikou Ferry, since ancient times, it has been the place of north-south commerce and goods distribution. It was the beginning port of the essence of Xikou culture development in Songshan area. In 2009, the Taipei Municipal Government completed the construction of the tinkou pier to extend the blue road route, and renovated the surrounding shore protection and water trails, and connected the pedestrian trail between the tinkou pier and the evacuation gate of base 4. The pier is close to the Rainbow Bridge, Songshan Cixi Palace, Raohe Night Market and other special attractions.

basicName: tai bei wen shan sen lin gong yuan
address: 116台北市文山區景豐街80號
review: N/A

address: No. 21-33, Section 1, Ren'ai Road, Zhongzheng District, Taipei City
review: Donghe Temple Guanyin Temple - Guanyin Temple located next to the East Gate of Taipei City, built in 1914, is the remnant of Cao Dongzong two main mountain Taiwan courtyards. The temple layout is a three-housing building, with red brick walls, black tile roofs, stone brick floors and so on. The mountain gate and the internal algae well have long-term and five-seven-square home grains and temple grains. The structure is typical of Taiwan's lifting beams (less columns, thick beams), and piercing (more columns, fine beams). In order to attract local Taiwanese believers, in addition to the Zen Hall, a special building was built, and even a Chinese stone lion was displayed at the door.

address: No.6, Ln. 7, Qingtian St., Da'an Dist, Taipei 10649, Taiwan
review: Qingtian 76 - Located at No. 6, 7 Lane, Qingtian Street, Taipei City, so it is also known as "Qingtian 76". This area is the most concentrated place of Japanese-style historical residence "camp house". In 1931, Professor Azuliren built the residence. The whole building is mainly built with teak wood. The left side of the house is the docking room. The study hall and canteen, with bookcases, glass windows, outdoor European flower beds and vestibules all in Western style, while the bedroom and sub-supply on the right side of the house are designed with Japanese tatami mats, and the whole building combines the advantages of Japanese and Western architecture. In 1945, he was moved in by his friend, Professor Ma Tingying, Department of Geology, Taiwan University, and in 2006 was officially listed as a monument by the municipal government.
